doc.after: In 1925 BuÃ±uel moved to Paris, where he began work as a secretary in an organization called the International Society of Intellectual Cooperation.[27]:p.124 He also became actively involved in cinema and theater, going to the movies as often as three times a day.[28] Through these interests, he met a number of influential people, including the pianist Ricardo ViÃ±es, who was instrumental in securing BuÃ±uel's selection as artistic director of the Dutch premiere of Manuel de Falla's puppet-opera El retablo de maese Pedro in 1926.[29]:p.29
